Job Title: Plant Maintenance Supervisor 

Location: North Little Rock, AR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Join our client’s team in Little Rock, AR, and take the next step in your career as a Plant Maintenance Supervisor. This leadership role is not just about working; it's about building a career in a dynamic and growing industry. Our client’s team values commitment to safety, punctuality, and initiative, and we are looking for a dedicated individual to lead our maintenance operations to success.
Responsibilities:Design and plan protocols for equipment or processes to ensure products meet internal and external purity, safety, and quality standards.Supervise and coordinate day-to-day functions in specialized departments such as Facilities Maintenance, Equipment Maintenance, and Vehicle Maintenance.Adhere to departmental expense budgets and apply value analysis to repair/replace, repair/redesign, and make/buy decisions.Manage technical resources and activities toward meeting project and process goals.Implement calibration programs for test equipment related to tank products and maintain preventative/predictive maintenance programs.Develop and maintain standard maintenance procedures and establish employee performance standards and expectations.Provide guidance, training, history tracking, troubleshooting, and resolution for all applicable specialized issues.Supervise and coordinate all activities of outside contractors, vendors, and services for construction, renovation, repairs, and special projects as appropriate to specific departments.Track equipment/systems performance, prepare reports, and make recommendations to Management.Perform administrative duties per company policy and participate in the final checkout of new installations.Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent experience.5-8 years of experience in project management, process standards development, facilities/production/equipment layouts/drawings, cost reduction, manufacturing/business planning systems, PC proficiency, and systems integration activities.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, budgeting, and cost containment skills.Strong analytical, problem-solving, supervisory, and leadership skills.Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software and basic understanding of ISO 9000 design requirements.Benefits:Competitive starting salary Opportunity for career growth and development in a dynamic and growing industry.Health and wellness benefits, including medical, dental, and vision coverage.Retirement savings plan and other employee benefits.Collaborative and supportive work environment with a focus on safety and excellence.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
